title: Honestly Muramana needs a rework, not buffs
body:
Because the only champ who uses this items is {{champion:81}} . The item has become outdated as a lot of the users have been reworked or have found better itemization. 

Hence the buffs on the PBE are a step in the wrong direction as it only benefits 1 champ. 


The item needs to appeal to more champs, mages included.

replies.body:
I actually think that Muramana is a pretty interesting item as is (sac your early game for a strong mid game spike), though external factors mean that its set of users is quite limited as you've noted. (Mana regen is high across the board, since AD items are so hard bound makes the opportunity cost very high, etc.). 

Also there's questions as to whether Jayce is a good muramana user from a game health perspective, because it reduces his reliance to get in melee range to solve his mana issues, but as we saw in the C9, SKT game, it also gives Jayce a bit of a better decision tree against tanky opponents where he'd otherwise run out of mana. 

Having said that, we don't have the scope to rework Muramana right now and buffing it up to retain its relative value to Crit items seemed like a better decision.

Think about it this kind of protect the adc comp could possibly be one of the best types of metas. Every role could be represented; you could have a utility support with a tank, assassin, adc, and a mage. This is because team fighting would be the focus of this meta. It'd be front to back with some spice and pretty good for competitive. Thing is an item like ardent cencer, or however you spell it, isn't a good way to do that. By making it an item riot made the most effective strategy in bot lane rushing this item. From there snowballing was much more likely since it amplified every adc spike afterwards, and the adc became the center of the meta because of how well adcs deal with certain strong tanks. Ofc this is hindsight bias of mine, if I was making the decision I probably wouldn't have done better.

If I was to change ardent cencer in a way to promote that meta I described I'd make it heal your ally after you heal or shield them for 5-50 on hit for some seconds and have some ap and move speed on it and cost some gold. Honestly, the range between an AD scaler who relies on Abilities, could be anywhere from an Assassin to a Juggernaut. But when people refer to an AD mage, it's usually a siege style mage with a lot of poke. (Since most AD burst fall into the category of Assassin) 

And it's interesting, cause whether an AP mage is classified as "Burst, Artillery, or Battle" doesn't change the fact that a major mana item is a core part of their build. But for AD counterparts, only the siege builds really need a significant source of mana in their itemization. 

So we are talking a very narrow band of champions who A) Scale of of AD, and B) want to poke. And some champs like Jayce who use to build Tear, look to different styles with different builds. (Namely, that Lethality builds will kill before mana's a problem) Likewise, the more AA centric champions turned to ER. 

It's difficult to really analyses this because Poke so far out of meta at the moment. Glass cannons are sustaining thanks to the enchanter meta, and Tanks have Knight's vow and Wormargs to shrug off damage. Meaning that nothing sticks. Personally though, I would actually look at the effect of the fully stacked Muranamana, since it basically functions on auto attacks. (For a siege style effect, shouldn't it's active/passive/whatever, be ability based?)
